description: Episode number 11 of Series "The Worlds of childhood". Explores caregiving and considers research on the effects of variations in sleeping, nursing, comforting and disciplining. Observes variations in caregiving in Japan, the U.S., Russia and among the Baka of Cameroon. Examines the importance of responsive interaction in building a positive relationship between the child and caregiver.
